name: Ms. Pac-Man Framework

screenshots.caption: The RateGraph shows how the learning process develops by plotting the agents lifetime and the score and reward.recieved during each game.
Optionally, the game can be graphically simulated to demonstrate the behaviour learned by the agent.
The Charter plots the various input values, to allow quick debugging of the input algorithms.
The QGraph plots the development of state-action values.

short_description:
This Java-application contains all required components to simulate a game of Ms. Pac-Man and let an agent learn intelligent playing behaviour using reinforcement learning and either Q-Learning or SARSA.

The framework was developed by Luuk Bom and Ruud Henken, under supervision of Marco Wiering, Department of Artificial Intelligence, University of Groningen. It formed the basis of a bachelor's thesis titled "Using reinforcement learning with relative input to train Ms. Pac-Man", L.A.M. Bom (2012).
summary: Using reinforcement learning with relative input to train Ms. Pac-Man
